sage.terrain

Interface ITerrain


  • public interface ITerrain
    ITerrain defines the interface implemented by components of the Sage terrain system. An ITerrain object can be one or many meshes representing a (usually large) piece of land. ITerrain objects are oriented such that Y is up, meaning gravity acts in the -Y direction. Level of Detail (LOD) is supported (although whether it is actually handled or not is a function of the implementation; some terrain implementations may choose to ignore LOD requests). ITerrain implementations should extend Group, or at least SceneNode.
    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine by bowens.

    • Method Detail

      • getHeight

        float getHeight(float x,
                float z)
        Get the world height of the terrain at the specified X-Z coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - the X world coordinate
        z - the Z world coordinate
        Returns:
        the world height at the given (x,z) point

      • getHeightmapHeight

        float getHeightmapHeight(float x,
                         float z)
        Get the heightmap height at the specified X-Z coordinate. This does not count scaling and snaps the XZ coordinate to the nearest (rounded) heightmap grid point.
        Parameters:
        x - the X world coordinate
        z - the Z world coordinate
        Returns:
        the height, unscaled and uninterpolated

      • setHeight

        void setHeight(float x,
               float z,
               float height)
        Set the height at the specified X-Z coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - - the X coordinate of the position whose height is being set
        z - - the Z coordinate of the position whose height is being set
        height - new height for the specified coordinate

      • adjustHeight

        void adjustHeight(float x,
                  float z,
                  float delta)
        Raise/lower the height in one call (instead of getHeight then setHeight).
        Parameters:
        x - - the X world coordinate of the position whose terrain height is being adjusted
        z - - the Z world coordinate of the position whose terrain height is being adjusted
        delta - - value to adjust the height by (can be positive or negative)

      • getHeightMap

        float[] getHeightMap()
        Get the heightmap of the entire terrain. This can return null if the terrain object does not store the height data. Infinite or "paged" terrains will not necessarily be able to support this, so use with caution.

      • useLOD

        void useLOD(boolean useLod)
        Tell the terrain system to use/not use Level of Detail (LOD) algorithms. Note that some implementations may choose to ignore this setting.

      • isUsingLOD

        boolean isUsingLOD()
        Check if the terrain is using LOD techniques. If a terrain system only supports enabled LOD, then this should always return true.

      • getMaxLod

        int getMaxLod()
        This is calculated by the specific LOD algorithm. A value of one means that the terrain is showing full detail. The higher the value, the more the terrain has been generalized and the less detailed it will be.

      • updateLOD

        void updateLOD(graphicslib3D.Point3D location)
        Called in the update (pre or post, up to you) method of your game. Calculates the level of detail of the terrain and adjusts its geometry. This is where the ITerrain's LOD algorithm will change the detail of the terrain based on how far away the specified position is from the particular terrain patch.
        Parameters:
        location - - the reference point from which the Terrain's LOD is calculated (often the Camera's location)
